body:
### Problem

#37910 maps any LSP method without a server capability to a dummy capability with the same name as the method.

`vim.lsp.buf_request()` checks if the client supports the method before sending the request, but any server following the LSP spec will not have a capability called "callHierarchy/incomingCalls", because the spec says the capability used to indicate support is "textDocument/callHierarchy". Thus, it will claim the method is unsupported and not send the request. Previously "callHierarchy/incomingCalls" was not in the capability map so the support check would return true.

I have an upstream fix at https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-languageserver-node/pull/1720 that was intended to resolve #37696, but it would also resolve this issue. However, I don't think the metamodel would get updated until a new LSP version is released. This would be broken in the meantime.

Note: `vim.lsp.buf.incoming_calls()` still works because it calls `client:request("callHierarchy/incomingCalls")` which does not check server capabilities first.

### Steps to reproduce using "nvim --clean -u minimal_init.lua"

Open a file and attach any server that supports call hierarchies, like clangd or emmylua_ls, and run the following.

`:=vim.lsp.get_client_by_id(1):supports_method('callHierarchy/incomingCalls')`

### Expected behavior

`vim.lsp.buf_request_sync(0, "callHierarchy/incomingCalls")` should succeed if the server supports "textDocument/callHierarchy".

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.12.0-dev-2404+gd9d8c660fd

### Language server name/version

n/a

### Operating system/version

n/a
